sen.j: 押領使（おうりょうし）とは、日本の律令制下の令外官の一つ。
sen.e: Oryoshi was one of ryoge no kan (official posts outside of the Ritsuryo code) under the Japanese Ritsuryo system (ancient centralized government system based on the Ritsuryo code).
Oryoshi was a ryoge no kan (official posts outside of the Ritsuryo code) under the Japanese Ritsuryo system (ancient centralized government system based on the Ritsuryo code).
"Oryoshi" was a ryoge no kan (official posts outside of the Ritsuryo code) under the Japanese Ritsuryo system (ancient centralized government system based on the Ritsuryo code).
sen.cmt: 統一リスト（その他 2009/6/29）の指示により、Oryoshi にダブルクォーテーションを追記しました。

sen.e: It was an official post in charge of police/military affairs.
It was an official post in charge of police/military affairs.
It was an official post in charge of police/military affairs.

sen.j: 延暦14年（795年）、防人の移動に携わっていた任務が文献に初めて登場している。
sen.e: Oryoshi first appeared in a document in 795 as a person who commanded sakimori (soldiers garrisoned at strategic places in Kyushu) to move.
Oryoshi first appeared in a document in 795 as a person who commanded sakimori (soldiers garrisoned at strategic places in Kyushu) to move.
Oryoshi first appeared in a document in 795 as a person who commanded sakimori (soldiers garrisoned at strategic places in Kyushu) to move.

sen.j: このときの職務は兵を率いたのみで、実際の戦闘には服役していない。
sen.e: At that time, oryoshi commanded soldiers but was not engaged in a battle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: At that time, oryoshi commanded soldiers but did not engaged in battles.
At that time, oryoshi commanded soldiers but did not engaged in actual battles.
sen.cmt: 「実際の」訳漏れin battles を in actual battles に修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、やがて押領使の職務内容は、移動させる兵の戦闘等の指揮官へと変化していく。
sen.e: Before long, however, oryoshi's job gradually changed to a battle director who commanded soldiers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Before long, however, oryoshi's job gradually changed to be that of a battle director who commanded soldiers.
Before long, however, oryoshi's job gradually changed to be that of a battle director who commanded soldiers.

sen.j: 押領使は、基本的には国司や郡司の中でも武芸に長けた者が兼任した。
sen.e: In principle, the post of oryoshi was concurrently assumed by kokushi (provincial governor) or gunji (locak magistrate) who excelled in military art.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In principle, the post of oryoshi was concurrently assumed by kokushi (provincial governor) or gunji (locak magistrate) who excelled in military art.
In principle, the post of oryoshi was concurrently assumed by kokushi (provincial governor) or gunji (localｌ magistrate) who excelled in military art.
sen.cmt: locak magistrate を local magistrate に修正しました。

sen.j: 主として現代でいう地方警察のような一国内の治安の維持にあたった。
sen.e: Oryoshi was mainly engaged in the maintenance of security in a province as with the current local police.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Oryoshi was mainly engaged in the maintenance of security in a province together with the current local police.
Oryoshi was mainly engaged in the maintenance of security in a province such as the current local police.
sen.cmt: 「現代でいう地方警察のような」together with the current local police をsuch as the current local police に修正しました。

sen.j: 中には、一国に限らず一郡を兼務していた者もいた。
sen.e: In some cases, oryoshi was responsible for the security in a district instead of a province.,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In some cases, oryoshi was responsible for the security in a district instead of a province.,
In some cases, oryoshi was responsible for the security in a district instead of a province.
sen.cmt: 文末のカンマを削除しました。

sen.j: さらに、東海道・東山道といった道という広範囲に渡っての軍事を担当した者もある。
sen.e: Further, there were cases where oryoshi was in charge of military affirs in a wide region like Tokaido/Tosando.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Further, there were cases where oryoshi was in charge of military affirs in a wide region like Tokaido/Tosando.
Further, there were cases where oryoshi was in charge of military affairs in a wide region like Tokai-do Road/Tosan-do Road.
sen.cmt: military affirs を military affairs に修正しました。用語集の表記に従い、Tokaido を Tokai-do RoadTosando を Tosan-do Road にそれぞれ修正しました。

sen.j: いずれにしても、地元密着型の職務であることから、押領使には土地の豪族を任命することが主流となり、彼らが現地において所有する私的武力がその軍事力の中心となった。
sen.e: At any rate, as oryoshi's job was locally-based one, local powerful families were mainly appointed to this post and their private military power was the main force of oryoshi.
At any rate, as oryoshi's job was based locally, local powerful families were mainly appointed to this post and their private military power made up the main force of oryoshi.
At any rate, as oryoshi's job was based locally, local powerful families were mainly appointed to this post and their private military power made up the main force of oryoshi.

sen.j: 下野国押領使として承平天慶の乱にて平将門を滅ぼした藤原秀郷などが有名。
sen.e: Fujiwara no Hidesato, who defeated Taira no Masakado as the oryoshi of Shimotsuke Province, is well-nown.
Fujiwara no Hidesato, who defeated Taira no Masakado as the oryoshi of Shimotsuke Province, is well-known.
FUJIWARA no Hidesato, who defeated TAIRA no Masakado as the oryoshi of Shimotsuke Province, is well-known.
sen.cmt: Fujiwara no Hidesato を FUJIWARA no Hidesato に、Taira no Masakado を TAIRA no Masakado に、それぞれ修正しました。

sen.j: なお荘園にも押領使は存在し、荘園内の治安の維持にあたったと思われる。
sen.e: It is considered that oryoshi also existed at shoen (manor) and was engaged in the maintenance of security in shoen.
It is believed that oryoshi also existed at shoen (manor) and was engaged in the maintenance of security in shoen.
